title: Game-Based Exploration of Ethical Theories: Civic Education and *The Walking Dead™*

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic ethical theories (deontology, consequentialism, virtue ethics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Students experience moral dilemma scenarios via game play after pre-assigned group formation, then discuss connections to real-world cases. Learn ethical decision-making processes visually and interactively through game scenario analysis

learning_goals: Students can apply at least three ethical theories (deontology, consequentialism, virtue ethics) to analyze conflict situations in games.
Learners can present and counter-argue the rationale behind ethical choices through discussions with peers.
Based on game-based learning experiences, learners create an ethical decision-making framework applicable to real-world civic contexts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
